qas.question: Fake fires were used as what kind of technique?
Two tanks one of oil, one of water fed what kind of fire?
What was injected into the fires from time to time to produce a flash?
What was the purpose of these fires?

context: The use of <a0_0>diversionary<a0_0/> techniques such as fires had to be made carefully. The fake fires could only begin when the bombing started over an adjacent target and its effects were brought under control. Too early and the chances of success receded; too late and the real conflagration at the target would exceed the diversionary fires. Another innovation was the <a1_0>boiler<a1_0/> fire. These units were fed from two adjacent tanks containing oil and water. The oil-fed fires were then injected with <a2_0>water<a2_0/> from time to time; the flashes produced were similar to those of the <a3_0>German C-250 and C-500 Flammbomben<a3_0/>. The hope was that, if it could <a4_0>deceive German bombardiers<a4_0/>, it would draw more bombers away from the real target.
